meanings.definition: Send a document or image electronically using a fax machine.
meanings.sent1: I will be telefaxing the contract to the client tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She telefaxed the report to the main office for review.
meanings.sent3: Telefaxing the invitation made sure everyone got a copy in time for the party.
meanings.sent4: His quick telefaxing of the information saved the day.
meanings.sent5: Telefaxing the map ensured they wouldn't get lost on the trip.

meanings.definition: The act of transmitting a document or image via fax.
meanings.sent1: The telefaxing of the signed agreement was successful.
meanings.sent2: We received the telefaxing of the proposal this morning.
meanings.sent3: The telefaxing of the funny picture made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The telefaxing of the urgent message was a relief.
meanings.sent5: The telefaxing of the diagram clarified the instructions.

meanings.definition: The technology or process of sending faxes.
meanings.sent1: Learning about telefaxing has been interesting.
meanings.sent2: The office upgraded their telefaxing system for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The telefaxing technology has come a long way since its inception.
meanings.sent4: Telefaxing has revolutionized how documents are shared.
meanings.sent5: The new telefaxing process is much faster than before.
